verses.kjv: Now upon the first day of the week, very early in the morning, they came unto the sepulchre, bringing the spices which they had prepared, and certain others with them.
verses.ct: On Sunday, at the very first light of dawn, the women went to the tomb carrying the spices they had prepared, along with some others who accompanied them.

verses.kjv: And they found the stone rolled away from the sepulchre.
verses.ct: They discovered that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb.

verses.kjv: And they entered in, and found not the body of the Lord Jesus.
verses.ct: When they went inside, the body of the Lord Jesus was not there.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as they were much perplexed thereabout, behold, two men stood by them in shining garments:
verses.ct: While they stood there completely confused about this, suddenly 2 men appeared beside them wearing dazzling clothes.

verses.kjv: And as they were afraid, and bowed down their faces to the earth, they said unto them, Why seek ye the living among the dead?
verses.ct: The women were terrified and dropped their faces to the ground. The men said to them, "Why are you looking for the living among the dead?"

verses.kjv: He is not here, but is risen: remember how he spake unto you when he was yet in Galilee,
verses.ct: "He is not here — he has risen! Remember what he told you while he was still in Galilee:"

verses.kjv: Saying, The Son of man must be delivered into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again.
verses.ct: "He said that the Son of Man had to be handed over to sinful men, be crucified, and rise again on the 3rd day."

verses.kjv: And they remembered his words,
verses.ct: Then they recalled his words.

verses.kjv: And returned from the sepulchre, and told all these things unto the eleven, and to all the rest.
verses.ct: They went back from the tomb and reported all of this to the 11 disciples and everyone else.

verses.kjv: It was Mary Magdalene, and Joanna, and Mary the mother of James, and other women that were with them, which told these things unto the apostles.
verses.ct: The women who shared this with the apostles were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, Mary the mother of James, and the other women with them.

verses.kjv: And their words seemed to them as idle tales, and they believed them not.
verses.ct: But the apostles thought it sounded like nonsense and didn't believe them.

verses.kjv: Then arose Peter, and ran unto the sepulchre; and stooping down, he beheld the linen clothes laid by themselves, and departed, wondering in himself at that which was come to pass.
verses.ct: Peter, however, jumped up and ran to the tomb. He bent down and saw only the linen wrappings lying there by themselves. He went away, amazed at what had happened.

verses.kjv: And, behold, two of them went that same day to a village called Emmaus, which was from Jerusalem about threescore furlongs.
verses.ct: That same day, 2 of them were traveling to a village called Emmaus, about 7 miles from Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And they talked together of all these things which had happened.
verses.ct: They were discussing everything that had taken place.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, while they communed together and reasoned, Jesus himself drew near, and went with them.
verses.ct: As they talked and debated with each other, Jesus himself approached and began walking with them.

verses.kjv: But their eyes were holden that they should not know him.
verses.ct: But something kept them from recognizing him.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What manner of communications are these that ye have one to another, as ye walk, and are sad?
verses.ct: He asked them, "What are you two discussing so intently as you walk? You seem so sad."

verses.kjv: And the one of them, whose name was Cleopas, answering said unto him, Art thou only a stranger in Jerusalem, and hast not known the things which are come to pass there in these days?
verses.ct: One of them, named Cleopas, replied, "Are you the only visitor in Jerusalem who doesn't know about the things that have happened there recently?"

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, What things? And they said unto him, Concerning Jesus of Nazareth, which was a prophet mighty in deed and word before God and all the people:
verses.ct: "What things?" he asked. They answered, "About Jesus of Nazareth. He was a prophet who demonstrated incredible power in what he did and said, in the sight of God and all the people."

verses.kjv: And how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him to be condemned to death, and have crucified him.
verses.ct: "The chief priests and our leaders handed him over to be sentenced to death, and they crucified him."

verses.kjv: But we trusted that it had been he which should have redeemed Israel: and beside all this, to day is the third day since these things were done.
verses.ct: "We had hoped that he was the one who would set Israel free. On top of all that, today is already the 3rd day since it happened."

verses.kjv: Yea, and certain women also of our company made us astonished, which were early at the sepulchre;
verses.ct: "And then some women from our group shocked us. They went to the tomb early this morning,"

verses.kjv: And when they found not his body, they came, saying, that they had also seen a vision of angels, which said that he was alive.
verses.ct: "and when they didn't find his body, they came back saying they had seen a vision of angels who told them he was alive."

verses.kjv: And certain of them which were with us went to the sepulchre, and found it even so as the women had said: but him they saw not.
verses.ct: "Some of the men who were with us went to the tomb and found it exactly as the women had described, but they didn't see him."

verses.kjv: Then he said unto them, O fools, and slow of heart to believe all that the prophets have spoken:
verses.ct: Then he said to them, "How foolish you are, and how slow your hearts are to believe everything the prophets declared!"

verses.kjv: Ought not Christ to have suffered these things, and to enter into his glory?
verses.ct: "Wasn't it necessary for Christ to suffer all these things and then enter into his glory?"

verses.kjv: And beginning at Moses and all the prophets, he expounded unto them in all the scriptures the things concerning himself.
verses.ct: Starting with Moses and going through all the prophets, he explained to them what all the Scriptures said about himself.

verses.kjv: And they drew nigh unto the village, whither they went: and he made as though he would have gone further.
verses.ct: As they got near the village where they were headed, he acted as if he were going to continue on.

verses.kjv: But they constrained him, saying, Abide with us: for it is toward evening, and the day is far spent. And he went in to tarry with them.
verses.ct: But they urged him, "Stay with us, because it's getting toward evening and the day is almost over." So he went inside to stay with them.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he sat at meat with them, he took bread, and blessed it, and brake, and gave to them.
verses.ct: When he was sitting at the table with them, he took the bread, gave thanks, broke it, and handed it to them.

verses.kjv: And their eyes were opened, and they knew him; and he vanished out of their sight.
verses.ct: At that moment their eyes were opened, and they recognized him — and then he disappeared from their sight.

verses.kjv: And they said one to another, Did not our heart burn within us, while he talked with us by the way, and while he opened to us the scriptures?
verses.ct: They said to each other, "Weren't our hearts burning inside us while he was talking with us on the road and explaining the Scriptures to us?"

verses.kjv: And they rose up the same hour, and returned to Jerusalem, and found the eleven gathered together, and them that were with them,
verses.ct: They got up right away and headed back to Jerusalem. There they found the 11 disciples gathered together with their companions,

verses.kjv: Saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and hath appeared to Simon.
verses.ct: who were saying, "The Lord really has risen! He has appeared to Simon!"

verses.kjv: And they told what things were done in the way, and how he was known of them in breaking of bread.
verses.ct: Then the 2 described what had happened on the road and how they recognized him when he broke the bread.

verses.kjv: And as they thus spake, Jesus himself stood in the midst of them, and saith unto them, Peace be unto you.
verses.ct: While they were still talking about this, Jesus himself stood among them and said, "Peace to you."

verses.kjv: But they were terrified and affrighted, and supposed that they had seen a spirit.
verses.ct: They were startled and terrified, thinking they were seeing a spirit.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Why are ye troubled? and why do thoughts arise in your hearts?
verses.ct: He said to them, "Why are you so troubled? Why are doubts filling your minds?"

verses.kjv: Behold my hands and my feet, that it is I myself: handle me, and see; for a spirit hath not flesh and bones, as ye see me have.
verses.ct: "Look at my hands and my feet — it really is me. Touch me and see for yourselves, because a spirit doesn't have flesh and bones like you can see I have."

verses.kjv: And when he had thus spoken, he shewed them his hands and his feet.
verses.ct: After saying this, he showed them his hands and his feet.

verses.kjv: And while they yet believed not for joy, and wondered, he said unto them, Have ye here any meat?
verses.ct: They still couldn't believe it because of their overwhelming joy and amazement. So he asked them, "Do you have anything here to eat?"

verses.kjv: And they gave him a piece of a broiled fish, and of an honeycomb.
verses.ct: They gave him a piece of broiled fish and some honeycomb.

verses.kjv: And he took it, and did eat before them.
verses.ct: He took it and ate it right in front of them.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, These are the words which I spake unto you, while I was yet with you, that all things must be fulfilled, which were written in the law of Moses, and in the prophets, and in the psalms, concerning me.
verses.ct: Then he told them, "This is what I was telling you while I was still with you: everything written about me in the Law of Moses, the Prophets, and the Psalms must be fulfilled."

verses.kjv: Then opened he their understanding, that they might understand the scriptures,
verses.ct: Then he opened their minds so they could understand the Scriptures.

verses.kjv: And said unto them, Thus it is written, and thus it behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day:
verses.ct: He told them, "This is what was written: Christ would suffer and rise from the dead on the 3rd day,"

verses.kjv: And that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in his name among all nations, beginning at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: "and repentance and forgiveness of sins would be proclaimed in his name to all nations, starting from Jerusalem."

verses.kjv: And ye are witnesses of these things.
verses.ct: "You are witnesses of all these things."

verses.kjv: And, behold, I send the promise of my Father upon you: but tarry ye in the city of Jerusalem, until ye be endued with power from on high.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — I am sending you what my Father promised. But stay in the city of Jerusalem until you are clothed with power from above."

verses.kjv: And he led them out as far as to Bethany, and he lifted up his hands, and blessed them.
verses.ct: Then he led them out to the area near Bethany, and he raised his hands and blessed them.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, while he blessed them, he was parted from them, and carried up into heaven.
verses.ct: While he was blessing them, he separated from them and was taken up into heaven.

verses.kjv: And they worshipped him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy:
verses.ct: They worshipped him and then returned to Jerusalem filled with tremendous joy.

verses.kjv: And were continually in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
verses.ct: They spent all their time in the temple, praising and blessing God. Amen.
